title: Birdman or(the unexpected virtue of ignorance)
Carol
notes: Beautiful looking and subtle love story.

title: Life During Wartime
notes: Took notes during this - Loved the Intense, sickly color palette. Great performances by Ciaran Hinds and Allison Janney. Enjoyed the music. Overall was very funny and harsh too - which was a good thing.

title: Fish Tank
notes: Drama. Low-key but amazingly tense as I was so invested in the characters.

title: Inside Out
notes: So clever and so much fun from Pixar.

title: The Boss
notes: Shame that the good bits are few and far between.

title: The Hidden Fortress
notes: Funny and epic.

title: The Lives of Others
notes: Very good drama set in the insane world of the GDR.

title: See No Evil, Hear No Evil
notes: Not their greatest work - but fun to see Richard Pryor and Gene Wilder together.

title: The Bedford Incident
notes: Enjoyably tense and taught.

title: Leaving Las Vegas
notes: Very unconventional love story with terrific performances

title: All About Eve
notes: Can see why it's a classic. Mouse?, never mouse.

title: Munich
notes: Decent thriller with a hefty dose of moral pondering.

title: RoboCop
notes: Dull. Gary Oldman always watchable, but whole thing felt really flat.

title: Midnight Special
notes: I liked that it didn't try to spell everything out and kept it simple and well played.

title: Philadelphia
notes: Difficult to mess up a courtroom drama. Especially with good actors.

title: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice
notes: Bit too serious and a bit of a mess.

title: Paths of Glory
notes: Two for the price of one - Courtroom drama AND military shenanegans. Plus, what an ending.

title: Imitation of Life
notes: Melodrama. Lush visuals and drama on steroids.

title: American Hustle
notes: Fun with quality scene stealing from Jennifer Lawrence

title: Oh! What a Lovely War
notes: Found it a bit of a chore. I imagine it was bold for its time.

title: Michael Clayton
notes: I like Tilda. I like George. Proper actors in a taught thriller not trying too hard.

title: Together
notes: Different culture feels exotic and feels good. Enjoyed it

title: Brokeback Mountain
notes: So much more than a gay cowboy movie - very good.

title: The Great Beauty
notes: Fine line between style and sleaze. Great party scenes.

title: Starter for 10
notes: Fairly pedestrian without being bad.

title: Requiem for a Dream
notes: Pretty trippy and then very grim - which I guess was the point.

title: Nebraska
notes: Heartwarming with terrific performances.

title: X-Men: Days of Future Past
notes: Proper superhero film - pitched just right

title: Volver
notes: Intriguing story put together with great acting. And a red Cortina estate.

title: Mean Streets
notes: Sprawling and messy but very watchable.

title: Hell and High Water
notes: Hilariously sexist - 'How did a girl who looks like that get mixed up in science?" But fun nonetheless.

title: Moonrise Kingdom
notes: Quality actors being charming. I liked it.

title: 21 Grams
notes: Gritty. Didn't need voice over.

title: Veronica Guerin
notes: Decent enough biopic. And needless voiceover at the end.

title: Hail,Caesar!
notes: Fun

title: The Counsellor
notes: Ran out of steam, and got worse the more the characters spoke.

title: Frank
notes: Loved it all. Makes me wish I could make music. Magical

title: Red Road
notes: Deftly done drama with healthy helping of tension.

title: Anatomy of a Murder
notes: Bit dated, but strange combination of jolly and cynical.

title: The Cruel Sea
notes: Stands up well. Broad and thoughtful.

title: Half Nelson
notes: Found it pretty tense. but good.

title: Mulholland Drive
notes: Wow. Well that will take some puzzling over.

title: The Eichmann Show
notes: Worth watching and neutrally played.

title: Metropolis
notes: Amazing. Must have blown people's minds in 1927.

title: The Grand Budapest Hotel
notes: Ralph Fiennes was great and whole thing was fun.

title: Le Havre
notes: Don't think it's possible to be more deadpan, but nice.

title: Ghost in the shell
notes: Nice ideas, cool animation and rubbish monologues.

title: Stalingrad
notes: Some standards tropes, but all well done with grim raw material.
